element.name: Phoenix Park - Cabra Gate by Lahtac, Traditional Cache (2/1)
element.description:
Dublin’s Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city.
At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed recreational spaces within any European capital city.

long-description.p: There are some thirty-eight lodges with living accommodation situated within Phoenix Park and no two dwellings are of the same design.

The wall is itself designated as a protected structure and stretches the entire way around the present-day park. It is eleven kilometres long and three metres high. The wall also supports its own particular flora.
The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and visitors can explore freely.
Bus Route(s): No's 10, 25, 37, 38, 39, 66, 67 from city centre.
Each of the vehicular gates into Phoenix Park has a gatekeeper’s lodge as part of the entrance cluster.
The cache is a tabloc box but so. Stealth required.

ul.li:
2010-06-11T19:00:00Z : Found it by Maji
Finally! & lessons re-learnt. Lesson 1 : plan your time carefully. Don't go when there's something on (no, not Bloom) and marshalls directing traffic at the gate. Lesson 2 : Don't go back after deleting the co-ords off your gps from the previous visit. Lesson 3 : Read the log entry so you're not looking for a magnetic micro when its a small tabloc. Lesson 4: And don't assume its in the obvious place(s). Sometimes, they only become obvious after you've found them! Last one of the series (unless you're planning NCR gate?) TFTC

2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by poohbear50
See GC284RJ Phoenix Park Ashdown lodge for our comments for this series. TFTC

2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by Wild Rover
See GC248RJ Phoenix Park Ashdown lodge for our comments and story for this Phoenix Park series. TFTC

2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by daraconn
7th cache of the Phoenix Park gate series. Found easily, thanks.

2010-06-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by rooske
Handy cach and dash

Dublin’s Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city.

At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed recreational spaces within any European capital city.

There are some thirty-eight lodges with living accommodation situated within Phoenix Park and no two dwellings are of the same design.

The wall is itself designated as a protected structure and stretches the entire way around the present-day park. It is eleven kilometres long and three metres high. The wall also supports its own particular flora.
The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and visitors can explore freely.

Each of the vehicular gates into Phoenix Park has a gatekeeper’s lodge as part of the entrance cluster.



The cache is a tabloc box but so. Stealth required.
